body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette Govr of Ky
Dear Sir

Not long since you issued three commissions to the following named persons in the 11th Ky Cav, to wit, William Mangan as Major, Thomas Bradbourn as 1st Lieut Co "H," James Powell 1st Lieut Co "B" All issued upon the recommendation of Lieut Col William O Boyle without consulting me,

I have since learned that Lieut Col Boyle represented himself to you as comdr of the Regiment at the time he made the recommendations and that he promised my approval of them should be obtained and forwarded to you, If so, the Col was greatly mistaken as I was commanding the Regiment myself at that time he being on Brevt Maj Genl Burbridge's staff, And I assure you that my approval can never be given on such recommendations,
There are others in the Regiment much better qualified for the positions and it would be a gross disregard of merit and seniority for them not the receive the promotions,

James Powell was once a confederate soldier, taken prisoner, and released from his imprisonment upon condition that he take the oath and enlist in our service, and therefore it is impossible for him to take the requisite oath upon being mustered on the commission he has received,

Gov I have written to you relition to this matter on two other occasions but I have not only failed to have the commissions revoked but failed to elicit a reply from you, for fear my letters did not reach you I send this one by Capt who will more fully explain my reasons for having these commissions revoked,

I have the honor to recommend that the following commissions be issued to the following named persons to wit Capt Wm H Bell as Major vice Boyle promoted or Mangan ^canselled^ coms 2 Lt John Burton as Capt Co D vice Bell promoted

Hsptl Stew Sabret Scruggs as 1st Lt Co D vice Robinson dismissed
Hspt Stew Sabret Scruggs as 2" Lt Co D vice Burton promoted
2nd Lieut Abraham W Stone as 1st Lieut ^Co B^ vice Hansborough promoted ^or Powells com canseled^
Sargt Jas H Dunn as 2" Lieut ^Co B^ vice Stone promoted
Coms M B Pulliam as Capt Co F vice Curd died when a prisoner, Pulliam is now a prisoner
Coms Sargt Simeon Wortham as Coms vice Pulliam promoted

Very Respt
Your Obt Servt
M. Graham Col
11th Ky Cav

Lexington Ky
Dec 8" 1864
Graham M.
Col 11" Ky Cav.
To The Gov.
says he is unwilling to approve the recommendations made by Lt. Col. W. O. Boyles & asks that the comns issued be cancelled- Recommends the promotion of officers & noncomod officers to fill vacancies in his regt-

L B No 8 - 1864 P. 496
Recd A. G. O. Dec 23d 1864
